padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1555935">astralmonad870</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-03">03/03/24 10:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells nearly identical to Bond No 9s Andy Warhol, of which Alexandria Fragrances sells an affordable dupe for 39. The plum note is the same, tart and delightful. Ive smelled Plum Japonais though and that one smells like spiced cardboard to me, no comparison at all.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="90117"comment_id="2080948"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/AIUla-90117.html?ccid=2080948#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2080399" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2080399" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cooling321"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1495871"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1495871.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cooling321" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ard-Al-Zaafaran/Midnight-Oud-66534.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.66534.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Midnight Oud"title="Midnight Oud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2080399ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2080399" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1495871">Cooling321</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-02">03/02/24 17:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is absolutely stunning plum vanilla saffron, Im completely addicted and quite frankly this is a masterpiece of the highest order.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="90117"comment_id="2080399"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/AIUla-90117.html?ccid=2080399#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2079240" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2079240" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Epsilonyx"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1913308"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Epsilonyx" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2079240ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2079240" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1913308">Epsilonyx</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-01">03/01/24 14:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It hit me with spice on the first spray black pepper, sharp, then turmeric shortly thereafter. Then it dried down, and the frankincense and vanilla swaddled some threads of saffron (the spices remained floating throughout, if not to become a bit gentler towards the end as the cardamom came out). I was surprised to see theres no Cypress! I also did not get plum, but its not a very familiar note to me, and Ive never smelled Plum Japonais.<br />
<br />
Overall, its okay, but the spice tincture was a bit too much for me. Reminds me of an Orthodox Church censer in some ways.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="90117"comment_id="2079240"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/AIUla-90117.html?ccid=2079240#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2078410" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2078410" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Turtle2"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1962244"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1962244.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Turtle2" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Halfeti-Leather-61523.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.61523.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Halfeti Leather"title="Halfeti Leather"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2078410ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2078410" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1962244">Turtle2</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-29">02/29/24 19:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>1.5 ml sample<br />
<br />
As most of the others have said, somewhere between Cairo with plum and Plum Japonais. As part of the dry down the plum turned a bit more winey.<br />
<br />
That being said my biggest qualm was the longevity, barely lasted an hour. Overall money would be better spent on Cairo IMO<br />
<br />
Update: Gave it a second chance and Wow what a difference.<br />
It appears that this is one that you need to apply more liberally (5-6 spritzes in my case); Its longer lasting than Juniper Sling or Endymion but not as potent as say Halfeti or one of the Portraits scents. <br />
<br />
In addition to the plum/winey notes before, the incense notes are coming off as more "clean" which might be the metallic notes and im definitely identifiny the smell of tumeric in the "cat pee" now. However I've managed to get compliments from several girls at the office with this one. Definitely gonna have to keep this on the radar and maybe score a few more samples.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="90117"comment_id="2078410"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/AIUla-90117.html?ccid=2078410#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2072225" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2072225" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Demons run"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2030435"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Demons run" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2072225ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2072225" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2030435">Demons run</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-23">02/23/24 23:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The plum is very prominent initially, but overall this is very similar to Cairo on the dry down - so similar in fact, if you have a bottle of Cairo already, you don't need a bottle of this. It's Cairo plus opening plum.<br />
Along with the same mid/base tones as Cairo, it shares a couple of it's other less nice characteristics. It's very powdery in a 'your grans bedroom' kind of way and has the very pungent 'cat pee' middle of Cairo. I can't put my finger on what that note is, but it literally smells like a moggy relieved themselves on your shirt.<br />
Overall, leave it long enough and it dries down to a spicy vanilla that's pretty long lasting. You'll have to suffer through the cat pee first though and that stage lasts a pretty long time.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="90117"comment_id="2072225"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/AIUla-90117.html?ccid=2072225#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2070631" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2070631" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="hkm279"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1660409"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="hkm279" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2070631ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2070631" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83); padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2093351" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cpsottak"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1460598"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1460598.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="cpsottak" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/SpongeBob-Squarepants/SpongeBob-28286.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.28286.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="SpongeBob"title="SpongeBob"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2093351ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2093351" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1460598">cpsottak</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-15">03/15/24 08:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Thank you Penhaligons for offering free samples on your website, i only had to pay shipping! <br />
This fragrance smells great, Penhaligons is my favorite house. I dont care if people say their fragrances smell like another/uninspired or if they smell designer.<br />
What Penhaligons is doing is releasing amazing, likeable, unique fragrances, that smell refined, quality, upscale! And this is another release that is all of those things.<br />
The opening has such a juicy plum, with such an aromatic depth, and the right amount of sweetness that is really unique to my nose.<br />
This to me is right down the middle unisex, however as a man i think on my skin the spice quality comes through enough to lean it masculine. I love the trade routes collection, and this one seems like a good choice for a signature scent to someone that like the sweet and spicy profile, you will definitely stand out from the crowd.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; Another beautiful creation from Penhaligon's.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="90117"comment_id="2112679"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/AIUla-90117.html?ccid=2112679#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2127383" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2127383" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="amnebe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1645213"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1645213.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="amnebe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Floral-Street/Wild-Vanilla-Orchid-47212.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.47212.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Wild Vanilla Orchid"title="Wild Vanilla Orchid"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2127383ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2127383" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1645213">amnebe</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-17">04/17/24 08:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is such a unique and gorgeous fragrance. It keeps morphing into something new every time you sniff. It starts out with a plum/cherry note and light citrus with spices you'd smell in Christmas desserts  mainly cardamom. The plum/cherry, cardamom, and saffron scent is always there, but sometimes the tobacco comes to the forefront. I could swear that I smelled cedar for a moment at the beginning. Then, it was heavy on the vanilla and saffron. Even though I normally think of spicy fragrances as being most appropriate for cold weather, the sweet fruity notes in this one make it medium-weight rather than heavy. So, it was fine wearing it in 90-F-degree weatther today. The fruity note reminds me a lot of the cherry scent in YSL's Black Opium Over Red. I tried making a sauce from cherries, cardamom, and safron, and the scent it gave off was fairly close to the way this fragrance smells. I'm kind of obsessed.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="90117"comment_id="2127383"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/AIUla-90117.html?ccid=2127383#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="90117" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Negative Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent2162196" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2162196" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MrAbbas"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1096131"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1096131.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MrAbbas" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2162196ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2162196" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1096131">MrAbbas</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-20">05/20/24 12:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Not my cup of tea. Very spicy and animalic with not very nice dry down. Penhalighon has better offerings.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="90117"comment_id="2162196"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/AIUla-90117.html?ccid=2162196#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2343974" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2343974" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Brutus"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1640834"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Brutus" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2343974ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2343974" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1640834">Brutus</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-10">11/10/24 02:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Huuh, <br />
I bought this sample because i like plum and tobacco.<br />
I feel no plum and no tobacco....<br />
The opening is all about the same disgusting saffron as in BR 540 and Widian Liwa.<br />
And the drydown smells just like some classic "old man perfume"<br />
I don't like this at all..</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="90117"comment_id="2343974"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/AIUla-90117.html?ccid=2343974#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="90117" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>

            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">18.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/designers/Maison-Martin-Margiela.html" class="en2inter">Maison Martin Margiela</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">19.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/designers/Givenchy.html" class="en2inter">Givenchy</a>
        </span>
    </div>

        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">20.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/designers/Montale.html" class="en2inter">Montale</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            </div>
        <div class="cell small-4 medium-2 flex-container flex-dir-column">
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">

<script  data-cfasync="false">
    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFFe5cbbe5e5f689826b719ace22a5b2a11');
        });
    }
</script>
